school.title: Iowa State University
description: Third-year student at ISU, majoring in Software Engineering and minoring in
Cybersecurity Engineering. Broad coverage of software development practices
and computer hardware, plus many individual and team design/programming projects.
3.99 GPA, dean's list all years.

work.title: Hy-Vee IT
description: Data Engineering intern at Hy-Vee's IT office, HST.
Helping to build a new central cloud-based data platform.
Deployed high-availability data movement software in Google Cloud
and developed several serverless integrations with third-party data providers
to reliably transfer data into BigQuery.

projects.title: Kill Bill 2
description: My largest, most ambitious project.
Built a video game from scratch in Java over 5 months
for the ISU COMS 309 course. Cross platform (Android <-> Desktop),
featuring an account system with secure authentication, a
secured UDP game server for realtime gameplay, and fully
custom graphics and UI rendering engine. Was also paired with
an account manager webapp as an SE 319 project. Received
Best Project Award out of ~70 projects.

projects.title: deploy-vps
description: A set of Ansible playbooks and GitHub Actions workflows which
entirely automatically deploy and maintain my Linux servers in
multiple environments. Includes automatic setup of
SSH, user lists, backups, monitoring, a mail server, a game panel,
and other services my projects make use of.

projects.title: tecktip.today
description: A "fun" website which gives you a randomized,
user-submitted tech tip from Linus Sebastian himself.
Features its own secure API and an admin management panel.
Deployed automagically using an Ansible playbook.

projects.title: very-alarming-pi
description: A work-in-progress project to develop an advanced
Raspberry Pi based alarm clock completely from scratch
with various innovative awakening methods, such as massive
speakers, flashing lights, vibrating bed shakers, and in-bed sensors.

projects.title: this website :)
description: My portfolio site. Made (mostly) on a 24 hour time crunch using
good ol' HTML, CSS, and JS - no external libraries involved.
Deployed automagically using an Ansible playbook.

projects.title: humecord
description: My first large-scale programming project, started in 2020.
An in-depth Discord bot framework, complete with an API, remote monitoring,
and detailed documentation. Used to create various fun bots to use within
Discord, including one to play music from YouTube, one that enabled playing
on a Minecraft server from a Discord channel, a remote server monitoring and
alerting bot, and quite a bit more.

projects.title: RC Pi
description: One of my earlier large-scale projects. Developed a remote-controlled RC car
controlled entirely via a custom phone app over a websocket and HTTP API.
Included a live-streamed video feed and a custom 3D-printed car running
a server on a Raspberry Pi and controlling motors over GPIO.
